This is easily one of the greatest games of all time. It beats out Portal 1 in almost every way possible. Its fun, challenging, and even emotional at the end of the story while still being super enjoyable if you ignore that completely. Seriously, don't even bother waiting for a sale or something to get it. Buy it and play it RIGHT NOW. Its %100 worth it.

Mi √∫nica queja seria que ya para el final, las c√°maras de prueba se sent√≠an como pantallas de carga jugables hasta el siguiente momento donde ocurriera algo relacionado con la historia, pero eso no le quita lo divertido pero se puede llegar a hacer algo cansado ya para el final, al menos es mi opini√≥n.

Never had a game change my life like Portal 2 did. I'm not a very serious gamer, but the things I've learned through going through this game were genuine life lessons. Creative problem-solving is useful in any situation, but the idea behind problem solving via portals is different. It challenges you to allow yourself to adapt to different situations and work with the resources you have access to, while also keeping you on your toes to be capable of functioning in changing environments. On top of that (I'll be general here to avoid spoilers), it's taught me a great deal about working with people you disagree with, as well as how to react when people you trust do things that you disagree with. In tandem, this game is a brilliantly crafted, mind-bogglingly beautiful challenge of mind and comprehension, as well as having some elements that provoke social skills and force you to deal with awkward situations
this is and underrated game, best in world

The best thing about this game is that you still feel the climate and the immersion like you felt in the official campaign even if you play community maps.

This is an absolutely "must play" for anybody, well unless you are really dumb - in that case you can watch walkthroughs on the net and still have a lot of the fun.

The most fun is of course when you solve all riddles yourself.
